tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE recipes (
  recipe_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  cooking_instructions TEXT,
  cooking_time INTERVAL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL DEFAULT now()
)

CREATE TABLE recipe_table (
  recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_name VARCHAR(100),
  preparation_time INT,
  cooking_time INT,
  ingredients JSON
);
CREATE TABLE recipe (recipe_id INT PRIMARY KEY, recipe_name STRING, ingredients STRING[], instructions STRING[])
CREATE TABLE cooking_programs (program_id INT PRIMARY KEY, program_name STRING, temperature INT, duration INT)
CREATE TABLE oven_logs (log_id INT PRIMARY KEY, timestamp TIMESTAMP, event STRING)
CREATE TABLE users (user_id INT PRIMARY KEY, username STRING, email STRING)

CREATE TABLE recipes (
  recipe_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_name VARCHAR(255),
  ingredients TEXT[],
  instructions TEXT[],
  cooking_time INTEGER
)

CREATE TABLE ovens (
  oven_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  oven_name VARCHAR(255),
  manufacturer VARCHAR(255),
  model VARCHAR(255),
  serial_number VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
  user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
  email VARCHAR(100),
  password_hash VARCHAR(255),
  created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE user_recipes (
  user_recipe_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id INTEGER,
  recipe_id INTEGER,
  date_added TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE recipe_reviews (
  review_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  recipe_id INTEGER,
  user_id INTEGER,
  rating INTEGER,
  review_text TEXT
)
